results.title: The Kill-off
results.creator_credit: Maggie Greenwald, Lydia Dean Pilcher and Filmworld International Productions
results.brief_description: Set in a bleak north-east American beach town, this nihilistic drama circulates around Luane, the bedridden town gossip, who manipulates members of the down-and-out community with her vicious rumour-mongering. Her machinations drive her victims to increasingly desperate acts that cumulate in a final showdown. While the world Greenwald reveals is relentlessly bleak, her portrayal of human sleaze and savagery is achieved by subtle means. She injects Thompson’s novel with a wry black humour and a hint of the surreal.

results.title: Lost honour of Katharina Blum = Die verlorene Ehre der Katharina Blum
results.creator_credit: Volker Schlondorff, Margarethe Von Trotta, Willi Benninger, WDR, Paramount Pictures, Orion Pictures Corporation, Cinema International Corp and Bioskop Film
results.brief_description: Katharina Blum (Angela Winkler) spends the night with Ludwig Goetten (Jurgen Prochnow), a new acquaintance who is, unknown to her, under police surveillance. This one night stand has serious repercussions for Katharina who is brought in for police questioning. Her basic civil rights ignored at every turn, Katharina is relentlessly grilled about her relationship with her one-night stand. As a result she loses her job, her friends, and her standing in the community. Unsatisfied with this, the police go after Katharina’s family. Her story is also exploited by the ‘yellow press’, which hounds her and depicts her as everything from loose woman to communist moll. And so, through the mirror of a manipulative press, Katharina becomes the most hated woman in Germany. The film achieves a compelling portrait of Germany in the mid-seventies (the lead years), during which the fight against the Red Army Faction led a number of State agencies to use any means possible to fight terrorism, while a manipulative right wing press sent an entire country in a frenzy over the breakdown of law and order. This originally made for TV production is adapted from the novel by Heinrich Boll (itself based on actual events). In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Street of shame = Akasen chitai [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Kenji Mizoguchi, Masaichi Nagata, Daiei Motion Picture Company and Janus Films
results.brief_description: The setting is a Tokyo brothel, ironically called Dreamland. The content is the thoughts, disappointments and aspirations of the occupants. This was Mizoguchi’s final film, and one in which he returned to his earlier theme of the exploitation of women throughout the ages. He does so by integrating the stories of five prostitutes which covers the roles of women as daughters, mothers and wives. Many believe that this film was pivotal in the 1957 decision to abolish prostitution in Japan. Cast includes Daisuke Kato, Machiko Kyo and Aiko Mimasu.

results.title: High and low = Tengoku to jigoku [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Ryuzo Kikushima, Tomoyuki Tanaka and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: In the first half a kidnapping takes place and a ransom is negotiated; the second half deals with the manhunt for the kidnapper. The Japanese title - Heaven and Hell - directly suggests exact opposites and more clearly encapsulates the theme. It begins in ‘Heaven’ - the apartment high over the city - and ends in ‘Hell’ - the alleyways of Yokohama. The first half is superficially theatrical in its refusal of conventional editing strategies but actually is notable for its subtle dramatic geometry involving permutations of position and composition afforded by the Scope screen. Multiple cameras were used to film long takes. The film suddenly opens out into an action-packed chase. Based on the novel “King’s Ransom” by Ed McBain. Cast includes Toshiro Mifune, Tatsuya Nakadai, Kyoko Kagawa. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Love is the devil: study for a portrait of Francis Bacon
results.creator_credit: John Maybury, Chiara Menage, British Film Institute and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: Love is the Devil: A Study For A Portrait of Francis Bacon is indeed a portrait in the style of controversial British painter Bacon. Like Bacon’s confronting yet compelling portraits, John Maybury’s film intensely focuses on its subject - revelling in distortion and pain. The film follows the turbulent, sado-masochistic relationship Bacon (Derek Jacobi) had with George Dwyer (Daniel Craig), who he meets when he accidently stumbles upon Dwyer attempting to burgle Bacon’s meagre apartment. Francis simply says to George: “Take off your clothes. Come to bed and you can have whatever you want”. The relationship has a destructive effect on the passive George who feels uncomfortable with Bacon’s eccentric friends (Tilda Swinton is especially creepy as one of this coterie), and who is continually tortured by Bacon’s sadistic enjoyment of pain and suffering. Derek Jacobi and Daniel Craig are excellent as the two main characters.

results.title: French cancan
results.creator_credit: Jean Renoir, Louis Wipf and Franco London Film (Paris)
results.brief_description: Beautifully photographed, this comedy-drama chronicles the revival of Paris’ most notorious dance as it tells the story of a theater producer who turns a humble washerwoman into a star at the Moulin Rouge. Renoir’s return to film-making in France after 15 years absence is an exuberant, affectionate homage to the theatre of ‘La Belle Epoque’ (Edith Piaf and Tatachou appear briefly as stars of the day.) It also gave him the opportunity to work with Gabin again, having made three films with him in the 1930s. Cast includes Jean Gabin, Francoise Arnoul and Maria Felix. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Marriage of Maria Braun = die ehe der Maria Braun
results.creator_credit: Rainer Werner Fassbinder, Michael Fengler, Filmverlag der Autoren, WDR, Trio and Albatros
results.brief_description: A tragicomedy spanning a decade which begins with the wedding of Maria Braun amid the chaos of an Allied bomb attack in 1943. Within 24 hours Maria’s husband is sent to the Russian front. Initially naive and idealistic, Maria increasingly adjusts to male values using her sexuality resourcefully but cynically in the pursuit of wealth and power. Yet she retains a romantic yearning for reunion with her missing husband which prevents her from fully living in the present. Fassbinder clearly means the film to be seen as an allegory about the German ‘economic miracle’ - the deep-seated continuity between past and present. Schygulla’s performance is deliberately dead-pan, taking the melodramatic mode to its limits, and reflecting Fassbinder’s interest in the melodramas of Douglas Sirk. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Tokyo story = Tokyo monogatari
results.brief_description: Ozu considered what many regard as his finest film to be about the disintegration of the Japanese family system. Ordinary family events - the visit of parents to see the children and their cool reception - are profoundly moving as Ozu portrays them. ‘Tokyo Story’ is actually a recasting of Leo McCarey’s ‘Make Way For Tomorrow’ which his collaborator, Noda, had seen but Ozu had not. As in most of his later films there is a pervasive nostalgia, a sense of loss. Although a loosely plotted leisurely survey of the extended family structured around journeys, the film is full of conflicts triggered by the grandparents’ visit in which characterisation both enriches and qualifies stark thematic oppositions.

results.title: The Italian job
results.creator_credit: Peter Collinson, Michael Deeley and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: When Charlie (Michael Caine) leaves jail he has the opportunity for a better future, or a sure fire way of landing back in jail when he inherits the plans to a $4,000,000 gold robbery. Things look positive when Charlie receives inside help from prison-based Mr Bridger (Noel Coward), who is the mastermind behind the plan. Central to the plan’s success is staging the world’s biggest traffic jam as a diversion to their shady activities. Cast includes Benny Hill, Raf Vallone and Tony Beckley. Music by Quincy Jones.

results.title: Cover girl
results.creator_credit: Charles Vidor, Arthur Schwartz and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A chorus girl is given a chance for stardom when she is befriended by a wealthy magazine editor who used to be in love with her mother. She is torn betweeen loyalty and the secret love she has for the nightclub manager where she works, and leaving for the bright lights and fortune that will await her as a cover girl. She is faced with a difficult choice between love and fame, or can she have both? Rita Hayworth and Gene Kelly who play the star crossed lovers are well supported by Phil Silvers and Eve Arden. (Awards: Jerome Kern and Ira Gershwin for Best Musical Score)
